dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAKE, HOLT, and CHARLES are in the wings of a small stage area. They look dapper in their dress blues.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: (can you believe it?) Charles! Medal of Valor!

dialogues.speaker: CHARLES
dialogues.text: I know!

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: For getting shot in the butt!

dialogues.speaker: CHARLES
dialogues.text: For “exceptional acts of heroism or voluntary risk of personal safety.” But you know, six of one.

dialogues.speaker: HOLT
dialogues.text: This is one of the NYPD’s highest honors. Today is your day, Detective Boyle. Charles smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON THE STAGE, DEPUTY CHIEF GERBER stands at the podium. Charles can be seen in the wings glowing with pride. Jake and Holt stand behind him, supportive.

dialogues.speaker: GERBER
dialogues.text: Heroism can’t be measured by a piece of metal, but it’s the best we can do to recognize brave officers who put their lives on the line. It is my great honor to present the Medal of Valor to Detective Charles Boyle... Charles walks on stage. The crowd, including AMY, TERRY, ROSA, GINA, SCULLY, AND HITCHCOCK applaud politely.

dialogues.speaker: GERBER
dialogues.text: -.--and Sergeant Peanut Butter! The crowd ERUPTS as A POLICE HORSE is lead onto the stage Jake turns to Holt, delighted.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: Oh my god, Charles is getting the same prize as a horse.  BROOKLYN NINE-NINE "The Bet" Shooting Draft 10/25/13 2.

dialogues.speaker: HOLT
dialogues.text: At least Boyle was announced first.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: Because the horse outranks him! This is amazing!

dialogues.speaker: HOLT
dialogues.text: That's enough, Peralta. This is a huge honor, and nothing can take that away from him--

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: The horse is pooping on the stage! Sergeant Peanut Butter is pooping on the stage! The horse NEIGHS.

dialogues.speaker: HOLT
dialogues.text: That is unfortunate. They both give a weak thumbs-up to Charles.

dialogues.speaker: END OF COLD OPEN
dialogues.text: BROOKLYN NINE-NINE "The Bet" Shooting Draft 10/25/13 3.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amy, Rosa, Terry, Hitchcock, and Scully work at their des Jake walks up to Amy, and they stare each other down.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Peralta.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: Santiago. The bet ends today. Are you ready?

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: I was born ready.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: -- to lose. The whole question was, “are you ready to lose?” And you said you were born that way.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Twist my words all you want -- I’m winning this bet.

dialogues.speaker: HITCHCOCK
dialogues.text: What bet? What are you guys talking about? Everyone turns to him in disbelief.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Seriously? “The bet?” Scoreboard in the briefing room. It comes up all the time. What are you doing all day?

dialogues.speaker: HITCHCOCK
dialogues.text: Nothing. Why, you wanna hang out?

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: A year ago today, Peralta and I made a bet to prove who’s a better detective. Whoever makes more felony arrests wins. 4 INT. BRIEFING ROOM — FLASHBACK —- ONE YEAR AGO (FBD) 4 The squad minus Holt is gathered. Jake and Amy argue.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: What are the stakes? And don’t say money, because I know you’re in debt.  BROOKLYN NINE-NINE "The Bet" Shooting Draft 10/25/13 4.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: If you knew anything about me, you'd say “crushing debt.” I’11 bet whatever, because I’m not losing.

dialogues.speaker: ROSA
dialogues.text: What about your car?

dialogues.speaker: CHARLES
dialogues.text: Not the ‘stang! That thing’s a date- * magnet. I mean, how many girls have you made out with in that car -- six?! (then) Bight?!!?

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: I’m gonna win, so sure: let’s bet the car.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLES
dialogues.text: Jakey, no! Thor would never wager his hammer. Neil Patrick Harris would never wager his showmanship! Losing that car would be the worst thing in the world for you.

dialogues.speaker: GINA
dialogues.text: (to Amy) What’s the worst thing in the world for you?

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Being one of those girls in Jake's Mustang.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Then it’s settled: if Peralta loses, Santiago gets his car. If Santiago loses, she goes on a date in said car. They SHAKE on it.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: That’s a very firm handshake.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: (steely) I took a seminar.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: And now the score is all tied up.  BROOKLYN NINE-NINE "The Bet" Shooting Draft 10/25/13 5.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: But not for long. In eight hours, I will win and then I will take Santiago on the worst date in the history of the world. (to Amy) You made your bed and now you’re going to lie in it. Don’t worry, “bed” is just metaphorical. Or is it?

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: I’m not worried, ‘cause tonight I’m driving home in your car. And then I’m driving to the junkyard, where I will have it smushed into a metal cube, which I will use as a cold, sharp ottoman. Captain Holt exits his office. Charles hobbles after him.

dialogues.speaker: HOLT
dialogues.text: Attention. After today’s shift, I’d like everyone to join me at the bar for drinks in honor of Detective Boyle and his Medal of Valor.

dialogues.speaker: GINA
dialogues.text: Oh my god, is Peanut Butter gonna be there? That horse is a damn hero.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLES
dialogues.text: Peanut Butter will not be joining us.

dialogues.speaker: HOLT
dialogues.text: He’s being féted at the United Nations. Holt returns to his office. Jake and Amy look at each oth then sprint after him. Jake pushes A CHAIR at Amy, then throws A PEN, then swipes A STACK OF PAPERS off GINA’S De

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: Rolly chair! Pen! Gina’s desk! He slams the door behind him. 6 INT. HOLT’S OFFICE — CONTINUOUS (D2) 6 Jake locks the door behind him. Amy struggles to open it.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: Hello, sir, you look very stoic today. Like a majestic old tree--

dialogues.speaker: HOLT
dialogues.text: I’m not going to give you more cases so you can win your bet with Santiago.  BROOKLYN NINE-NINE "The Bet" Shooting Draft 10/25/13 6. 6 10

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: What?! Oh, right the bet, I totally forgot--

dialogues.speaker: HOLT
dialogues.text: Granted, this “friendly competition” has led to you and Santiago putting in more hours and arresting more perps. Especially this last week. INT. BULLPEN — FLASHBACK — MONDAY (FBD) 7 Amy walks in with A PERP. Jake stares. She CHANGES a numb on the DRY ERASE BOARD. She’s up by one.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Up by one, Peralta! Anything you want to say to your car before you never see it again? “Bye bye?” “I love you?” “I'm sorry I let Santiago sell you for parts?” INT. BULLPEN — FLASHBACK - TUESDAY (FBD) 8 Jake walks in with A PERP. Amy watches. They are TIED on the board. Jake erases and then adds one to his side.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: Oh hi, Santiago. Do you have any dietary restrictions that Medieval Times should know about? I’m booking us a table in the middle of the jousting ring! INT. BULLPEN — FLASHBACK — WEDNESDAY (FBD) 9 Amy walks in with ANOTHER PERP. Jake watches. She erases the number and puts herself up by one.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: (on the phone) Yes, 3-1-1? What’s the safest way to set a car on fire? INT. HOLT’S OFFICE - BACK TO SCENE (D2) 10

dialogues.speaker: HOLT
dialogues.text: Both of you have done exemplary work, which I appreciate.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: And I can see that by the absolutely no indicators on your face.  BROOKLYN NINE-NINE "The Bet" Shooting Draft 10/25/13 7. 10 11

dialogues.speaker: HOLT
dialogues.text: However, you are colleagues. And the fallout from this bet has the potential to put a strain on your professional relationship.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: Only if I lose. I’m a terrible sport. *

dialogues.speaker: HOLT
dialogues.text: Cases will be assigned as they always are. Dismissed. Jake exits. Amy busts in.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Captain! You look--

dialogues.speaker: HOLT
dialogues.text: No. INT. BULLPEN - CHARLES’ DESK - LATER (D2) 11

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charles pours water into a slow drip (Chemex type) COFFEE MIXER. Rosa enters. Holt and Gina are nearby.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLES
dialogues.text: Rosa, hey, would like to have a cup of coffee with me? I got some gorgeous new coffee beans.

dialogues.speaker: ROSA
dialogues.text: (gritted teeth) Sure. That sounds great.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLES
dialogues.text: It is great. First, we weigh out exactly 24 grams of coarsely-ground beanage. It should have the consistency of Tunisian sand.

dialogues.speaker: ROSA
dialogues.text: Fun.

dialogues.speaker: GINA
dialogues.text: Isn’t that like your fifth cup today?

dialogues.speaker: CHARLES
dialogues.text: I’m trying to counteract the drowsiness from my pain meds. I took a double dose after the incident at the ceremony.  BROOKLYN NINE-NINE "The Bet" Shooting Draft 10/25/13 8. 12 INT. CEREMONIAL HALL ~— FLASHBACK (D1) 12 Charles and Peanut Butter stand in front of 10 PHOTOGRAPH

dialogues.speaker: PHOTOGRAPHER
dialogues.text: Bring Peanut Butter forward. Forward. Forward. Can the little guy just take a big step back, please?

dialogues.speaker: CHARLES
dialogues.text: My name is Boyle! I won the same Medal as this horse! Aaaaaaaarrrgghhh! He steps backwards and IMMEDIATELY FALLS OFF THE STAGE.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLES
dialogues.text: The footage of my fall lead the local news, so who’s the hero now, Peanut Butter?

dialogues.speaker: GINA
dialogues.text: Peanut Butter.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLES
dialogues.text: Gina, you're just trying to hurt me to distract yourself from your own internal pain. Also, you should use less * conditioner, because that’s a flat mess. * Charles exits.

dialogues.speaker: HOLT
dialogues.text: What is going on with Boyle?

dialogues.speaker: ROSA
dialogues.text: His pain meds are making him weird.

dialogues.speaker: GINA
dialogues.text: Ohhhh. This happened to my dad when he got his vasectomy un-reversed. You get all relaxed and you have no filter, so you drop truth bombs all over everyone.

dialogues.speaker: HOLT
dialogues.text: Hm. That explains the elevator. 14 INT. ELEVATOR —- FLASHBACK - 30 MINUTES AGO (D2) 14 Charles on the elevator. Holt gets on.  BROOKLYN NINE-NINE "The Bet" Shooting Draft 10/25/13 9. 14 15 16

dialogues.speaker: CHARLES
dialogues.text: Hello, Captain. I’m worried you don’t find me interesting. I wish there were a third person in here. I’m going to pretend someone texted me. (making texting sound) Bloop! He pulls out his phone.

dialogues.speaker: HOLT
dialogues.text: Gina, please keep an eye on Boyle today. He’s going to say something to the wrong person and get himself punched.

dialogues.speaker: GINA
dialogues.text: For sure. I would love to see Charles get punched.

dialogues.speaker: HOLT
dialogues.text: Try again.

dialogues.speaker: GINA
dialogues.text: I will keep Charles from getting punched.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake walks in a PERP.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: Up by two, Santiago. I hope you got your cats a sitter tonight, because I'd hate for them to be lonely while we’re out on our date, having the time of my life.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: I don’t have cats. I live alone.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: Cool brag.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: You know who doesn’t live alone? The Bardon twins, whom I just busted for a B&E. Tie ballgame. Reveal: TWO TWINS in the holding cell.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: They have the same DNA -- they should only count as one!  BROOKLYN NINE-NINE "The Bet" Shooting Draft 10/25/13 10. 17 INT. HOLT’S OFFICE — LATER (D2) 17 Terry enters. Holt sits at his desk.

dialogues.speaker: HOLT
dialogues.text: Sergeant Jeffords, I’m honored to give you back your gun. You are officially cleared for active duty. Holt solemnly presents TERRY'S GUN to him. Terry takes it with equal gravitas.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Thank you, sir. It’s good to be back.

dialogues.speaker: HOLT
dialogues.text: I sent Gina out to get a congratulatory card. He hands Terry A CARD.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: “Through rain, hail, sleet, and snow, you never fail to deliver. Thanks for being a great mailwoman.”

dialogues.speaker: HOLT
dialogues.text: She did not look very hard. But you * understand the sentiment. *

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Yes, sir. I assure you, I can’t wait to * get out there and kick crime in the ass. * Terry’s phone RINGS. Holt nods at him and he picks it up.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Hey baby. Yeah, I can do a quick story. (to Holt, hushed) At nap time, I tell my twins about a tiny princess who rides on a sparrow’s back.

dialogues.speaker: HOLT
dialogues.text: Childhood is a time of whimsy. Dismissed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amy hurries in with A PERP in tow. She is out of breath.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Ladies and Gentlemen, I present Carl Laudson, who stole 3000 dollars! Santiago takes the lead with one minute left! Suck it, Peralta!  BROOKLYN NINE-NINE "The Bet" Shooting Draft 10/25/13 11.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: (unconcerned) Oh no.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: That’s right ‘oh no’-- (realizing) Oh no, you don’t seem worried. Why aren't you worried?

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: Bring in the johns! Jake stands. A UNIFORMED COP brings in TEN JOHNS.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: I ran a prostitution sting through Vice, and arrested thirty guys for soliciting.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: That’s not a felony.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: It is if it’s your second offense. Which is the case for ten of these gentlemen. Little trivia -- four of them are actually named John! Ironic. Anyhoo, ten more for Peralta. Accept your fate!

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Never! *

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: Five... four... three... two... one! It's over. Jake wins! Amy loses! He hits play on A BOOMBOX: “Celebrate” by Kool & the Gang PLAYS. Jake’s given everyone noisemakers, confetti, etc. flips the DRY ERASE BOARD, it reads: “PERALTA WINS.” Amy sits, defeated. Jake drops to one knee and produces A RIN

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: Amy Santiago, you have made me the happiest man on Earth. Will you go on the worst date ever with me? You have to * say yes!

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: -..Yes.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: She said yes! She said yes!

dialogues.speaker: END ACT ONE
dialogues.text: BROOKLYN NINE-NINE "The Bet" Shooting Draft 10/25/13 12. 19

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake is in his Mustang. He lays on his HORN, yelling. NEIGHBORS and PASSERS-BY stop and look, annoyed.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: Amy Santiago! Date Time! Time to date! (to a passing gawker) Hi there. Sorry, I’m taken. The woman who lives in that apartment loves me. Amy sticks her head out the door.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Peralta, this outfit is ridiculous.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: Should’ve thought of that before you spent all year losing our bet. Chop chop, there’s a lot of embarrassing to do and not a lot of hours to do it in. Jake lays on his HORN again. Amy exits. She is wearing a very puffy, bright blue dress with a big bow on the butt. She looks like she just stepped out of a ‘90s Bat Mitzvah

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Happy?

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: Yes! You look like every girl I ever had a crush on at every Bat Mitzvah. Let me see the bow. She turns around.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: Just like Jenny Gildenhorn. I wish you had braces. Should we get you braces? No -- that’s too much. Jake exits the car. He looks quite handsome in a tuxedo.. until he walks around to open Amy’s door and we see that wearing cargo shorts and sneakers.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Nice shorts.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: Thank you. Believe it or not: they weren’t that expensive.  BROOKLYN NINE-NINE "The Bet" Shooting Draft 10/25/13 13. 19 20 21

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Do I really have to wear this all night?

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: You know the rules. The date begins now and ends at midnight. I decide what you wear, what you eat, and where we go. Oh, and there’s one last rule. He takes Amy’s hands and looks deep into her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: No matter what happens, you’re not allowed to fall in love with me.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Won't be a problem.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: (opening her car door) M‘ lady?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake drives away and we reveal his car is dragging CANS a has A SIGN that reads: 'Just Lost A Bet.' INT. BAR —- SAME (N2) 21 Gina, Terry, Holt, and Rosa are drinking at a table. Char talks to Chief Gerber. *

dialogues.speaker: GERBER
dialogues.text: Detective Boyle. I just stopped by to * say congratulations. Your medal was well- * deserved.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLES
dialogues.text: Thank you, sir. Your breath is terrible.

dialogues.speaker: GINA
dialogues.text: Charles, can I speak with you? She leads Charles away, turning back to Gerber as she goe

dialogues.speaker: GINA
dialogues.text: Thank you for coming, Mr. President. *

dialogues.speaker: CHARLES
dialogues.text: Where’s Rosa? I haven’t seen her all night. Did you know my wife pays me alimony?  BROOKLYN NINE-NINE "The Bet" Shooting Draft 10/25/13 14.

dialogues.speaker: GINA
dialogues.text: Okay...let’s take a seat. I’m gonna keep an eye on you tonight, little buddy.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLES
dialogues.text: Thanks! ANGLE ON: SHARON, Terry's wife, enters and he waves her o

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Hey, you made it! Captain, I’d like you to meet my wife, Sharon.

dialogues.speaker: SHARON
dialogues.text: I’ve heard so much about you. It’s wonderful to finally meet you.

dialogues.speaker: HOLT
dialogues.text: And you. Your husband is a hero. If you ask me, he should’ve been up there with Detective Boyle today.

dialogues.speaker: SHARON
dialogues.text: What for?

dialogues.speaker: HOLT
dialogues.text: For saving my life.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: He means metaphorically -- like, saving him from paperwork. Paper cuts are a slow death, baby.

dialogues.speaker: HOLT
dialogues.text: No, I was referring to how he threw his body at the emotionally disturbed criminal who was trying to kill me. 22X EXT. RAIL YARDS - NIGHT (FLASHBACK FROM “CHRISTMAS” ) Haimes points a gun at Holt, when TERRY TACKLES HIM!

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Nooooo00000000!

dialogues.speaker: SHARON
dialogues.text: He did what?! You’re back in the field?

dialogues.speaker: HOLT
dialogues.text: Ah. I have caused a problem. I think I am...getting a text message. (quietly)  BROOKLYN NINE-NINE "The Bet" Shooting Draft 10/25/13 15. 23 24

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Bloop. (then) There it is. He moves a step away.

dialogues.speaker: SHARON
dialogues.text: Why is this the first I’m hearing about this?

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: I thought I told you. Remember, you were half asleep, watching the news and the babies were crying and I said real low, 'Hey baby, I'm back in the field. You want something to eat?' And you were like, 'What?' and I was like, ‘Something to eat?' And you said, 'Sure' -- and I brought you an oatmeal cookie? Remember?

dialogues.speaker: SHARON
dialogues.text: You are a piece of work, Terrance. Sharon storms off, annoyed. Terry turns to Holt.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Aw damn. She called me Terrance! I’m * doomed. * Terry DOWNS a DOUBLE WHISKEY in one gulp.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: God, I wished I weighed less. This isn’t even making me warm. Terry walks off after Sharon. *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake and Amy arrive at the bar. Jake holds up A BULLHORN, presses the SIREN for a beat, then speaks into it:

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: Attention, everyone! Obviously, this is Charles’ night. But forget about that for a second, and admire, take pictures, and comment on every aspect of-- (waving hands in front of Amy) this.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Ugh. Permission to go to the bathroom?  BROOKLYN NINE-NINE "The Bet" Shooting Draft 10/25/13 16.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: Granted. First of three. Use them wisely. Amy exits. Jake sidles up next to Charles at the bar.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: Congrats again, buddy, I really am proud of you. Still wearing the medal, huh?

dialogues.speaker: CHARLES
dialogues.text: Yes, I want women to be impressed by me.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: Allllright... Well, sorry I can’t stay, but I’ve got a terrible night planned for Amy. First up, the mall Photo Studio for our official date portrait. The picture will be the two of us playing one saxophone. Then, a dinner of peel-and- eat shrimp at a dangerously cheap seafood restaurant. And then: I have contracted a youth choir to serenade us. *

dialogues.speaker: INT.
dialogues.text: Jake Jake stands in front of a YOUTH CHOIR.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: Okay, let’s hear it. conducts the choir as they sing the “Hallelujah” chorus.

dialogues.speaker: YOUTH CHOIR
dialogues.text: Saaaaan-tiago! Santiago! Santiago! Saaaaan-tiago! You su-u-ck so bad!

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: They're gonna sing to her at midnight in the middle of Times Square. She and 5000 German tourists will remember that moment for the rest of their lives.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLES
dialogues.text: Jake, do you know why little boys pull little girls’ pigtails on the playground?

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: ‘Cause they’re so easy to grab, they’re begging to be pulled.  BROOKLYN NINE-NINE "The Bet" Shooting Draft 10/25/13 17. 26 27

dialogues.speaker: CHARLES
dialogues.text: Because they like the girls and it’s the only way they know how to get their attention.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: ...What are you saying?

dialogues.speaker: CHARLES
dialogues.text: All of this teasing and this elaborate date... somewhere, down deep, you like Amy. Like: “like her,” like her.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: Okay, that’s straight-up insane.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLES
dialogues.text: How much did you spend on tonight?

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: Don’t worry about it. Fourteen hundred dollars. But it’s all on credit cards, so really, five dollars a month for the next 2000 years. I do not like Amy!

dialogues.speaker: CHARLES
dialogues.text: You’re putting a lot of effort into a joke. Why don’t you just sit down and have a real conversation with her?

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: Charles, you live in your ex-wife’s new boyfriend’s basement. I don’t think I’m gonna take advice from you. Jake walks away. Charles calls after him:

dialogues.speaker: CHARLES
dialogues.text: I’m ashamed of my living situation!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gina walks up to Rosa, who is drinking in the corner by t payphone, making herself small against the wall.

dialogues.speaker: GINA
dialogues.text: Hey, you hiding? I love hiding. Who are we hiding from?

dialogues.speaker: ROSA
dialogues.text: I’m avoiding Boyle and his truth bombs. 26 27

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BROOKLYN NINE-NINE "The Bet" Shooting Draft 10/25/13 18. 28 29 30 INT. BAR —- FLASHBACK - 20 MINUTES AGO (N2) 28 Charles talks to Hitchcock.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLES
dialogues.text: I sometimes worry I’m going to become you.

dialogues.speaker: ROSA
dialogues.text: He keeps saying he wants to talk to me. I’m afraid he’s going to tell me he loves me or propose or something.

dialogues.speaker: GINA
dialogues.text: He should smelt the bullets from his butt and make you a ring. (fanning her eyes) Oh my god, I’m gonna cry...

dialogues.speaker: ROSA
dialogues.text: Boyle dove in front of those bullets for me. I can’t be mean to him -- I watched him make coffee for 28 minutes this morning. But I also don’t want to lead him on...

dialogues.speaker: GINA
dialogues.text: Well, Holt told me not to let him get hurt tonight, so I will keep him away from you. Charles walks up. Rosa scurries away.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLES
dialogues.text: Have you seen Rosa?

dialogues.speaker: GINA
dialogues.text: Rosa died eight years ago. Let’s get you a drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake stands in the center of the bar.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: Attention, everyone! We are about to leave, but now, for the first time as winner and loser, Santiago and I will perform the steerage jig from the film, “Titanic,” which we have in no way practiced. A POLKA starts playing. Charles asides to Jake:  BROOKLYN NINE-NINE "The Bet" Shooting Draft 10/25/13 19.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLES
dialogues.text: Romantic.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: No. Embarrassing. (then, to the crowd) Please note, when Amy blushes, it starts at the tippy-top of her ears so watch for that! Jake walks up to Amy and starts spinning her around.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: I hate your guts.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: Channel that passion into the dance, baby.

dialogues.speaker: HOLT
dialogues.text: Peralta. Holt motions for Jake.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: Scully. Tag in.

dialogues.speaker: SCULLY
dialogues.text: Okay! Jake crosses to Holt. Scully starts jigging his ass off around Amy. Scully and Amy’s dance plays out in the background during the following:

dialogues.speaker: HOLT
dialogues.text: One of our informants just called. We’ve been tracking a crew that lifts cargo from Laguardia. The CI knows where the trucks unload, and I need you to go stake out the drop-site. Jake looks over to Amy dancing...

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: Sir, I’m right in the middle of this date and I can’t reschedule. I have far, far too many non-refundable deposits. I’m renting a tiger cub by the hour!

dialogues.speaker: HOLT
dialogues.text: For what?  BROOKLYN NINE-NINE "The Bet" Shooting Draft 10/25/13 20.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: Don’t even know. Waiting for inspiration.

dialogues.speaker: HOLT
dialogues.text: This is not a negotiation. Go.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: Fine. But I’m taking Santiago, so the minute we’re done we’re back to the date. (to Amy) Darling? Brief pause. Duty calls.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Thank god. They head out.

dialogues.speaker: SCULLY
dialogues.text: Gina! Tag in!

dialogues.speaker: GINA
dialogues.text: Not even if it would cure cancer.

dialogues.speaker: END ACT TWO
dialogues.text: BROOKLYN NINE-NINE "The Bet" Shooting Draft 10/25/13 31 32

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake and Amy are back in their regular clothes. They sit the car. Jake looks through BINOCULARS.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: I’m so happy to be out of that dress. It was weirdly hot.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: Oh yeah, it was a cotton-plastic blend. But don’t get too comfortable. We’re gonna catch these guys and get right back to the worst night of your life. Jake reads a text on his phone.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: Ugh. I have to cancel our theater reservation.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: I don’t even want to know.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: Then I’1l tell you! It was an interactive musical called, “Uncle Milton’s Crazy Armenian Funeral.” You were going to be dragged on stage to play the nanny he died in bed with.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Ha ha. I’m so happy LaGuardia was robbed tonight. Hopefully, someone will also rob JFK.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: Don’t worry, there’s plenty of date left, including a grand finale at midnight. INT. REC ROOM — FLASHBACK (D2) A33 The choir is rehearsing. ONE LITTLE BOY sings in high falsetto, while the choir backs him up.

dialogues.speaker: CHOIR BOY YOUTH CHOIR
dialogues.text: For you suck at detective Santiago, Santiago, work, Amy! Santiago... 21.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BROOKLYN NINE-NINE "The Bet" Shooting Draft 10/25/13 22.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: It’s gonna be great. For me and the * kids. They get to stay up so late! * A TRUCK pulls up. Jake and Amy perk up... but it rolls on

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: Is that the truck? Please let it be-- Nope. “Artisanal Soft Serve.” Thanks a lot, Brooklyn! INT. BAR —- SAME (N2) 33 Terry and Sharon talk it out at a quiet corner table.

dialogues.speaker: SHARON
dialogues.text: Why would you go back in the field and not tell me?

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: You don’t tell me everything you do. Like when you bought our girls those fur vests!

dialogues.speaker: SHARON
dialogues.text: You love those vests!

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Yeah, because they’re adorable! But I wasn’t consulted. (off her look) Baby, I’m sorry. Captain’s life was in danger and I just did what I had to do. It was an impulse decision.

dialogues.speaker: SHARON
dialogues.text: I guess I can kind of understand that. Holt walks up.

dialogues.speaker: HOLT
dialogues.text: Sharon, I have to apologize. I want to assure you that the call to put Sergeant Jeffords in the field wasn’t some spur of the moment, impulse decision. It’s been in the works for a few months now.

dialogues.speaker: SHARON
dialogues.text: Months? Terry said it just happened. You need to get your stories lined up. Sharon glares at Terry and storms off again.  BROOKLYN NINE-NINE "The Bet" Shooting Draft 10/25/13 23.

dialogues.speaker: HOLT
dialogues.text: Perhaps I should stop talking to your wife.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: That’s a good call. Terry chases after Sharon, frustrated. 34 INT. JAKE’S CAR - A LITTLE LATER (N2) 34 Jake and Amy, still on the stakeout. Jake checks his watc

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Ten pm. These wonderful thugs have saved me another hour of humiliation.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: Yeah, well, I’m not giving up. There's still time for us to get back to the worst date of your life.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Hmmm no. Nothing will ever be worse than the date I had with my aunt’s dentist...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amy sits across from DOCTOR NASH, a dentist.

dialogues.speaker: DR. NASH
dialogues.text: Here -- try some of this! He offers a bite of food on his fork, then uses the fork a SPOON to hold her mouth open and look at her teeth.

dialogues.speaker: DR. NASH
dialogues.text: Well, dessert is out of the question. Amy looks concerned. 36 INT. JAKE’S CAR - BACK TO SCENE (N2) 36 Jake and Amy laugh.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: What was your worst date ever?

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: It's like a fifty-way tie. Recently I went out with a lady who thought our president’s name was “The Rock Obama.” Jake notices something.  BROOKLYN NINE-NINE "The Bet" Shooting Draft 10/25/13 24.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: Hey, those people left the door open. I bet that roof has a better vantage point.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: And I bet it doesn’t smell like old cheese.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: Hey. That’s offensive. It’s old meat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holt notices Sharon near the coat-check, berating Terry:

dialogues.speaker: SHARON
dialogues.text: What else don't I know, Terrance? Are you cooking meth? Are you breakin' bad? How many phones do you have? Holt approaches.

dialogues.speaker: HOLT
dialogues.text: I’m sorry. I need to clarify something I said earlier. Technically, Sergeant Jeffords was correct when he said his choice to go back in the field that night was an impulse decision. He didn’t even take the time to stop and gear up--

dialogues.speaker: SHARON
dialogues.text: WHAT?! You weren't wearing your vest?

dialogues.speaker: HOLT
dialogues.text: Oh goodness. Ohhhhhh my. I shouldn’t have said that. I feel I may have made things worse. Charles bursts upon the scene.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLES
dialogues.text: Wait! I can fix this, Ray. (off Holt’s look) Sorry, butt meds, Ray. Can’t stop saying Ray. Ray Ray Ray Ray.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Now’s not a good time, Boyle-- Sharon puts her hand over Terry’s mouth.

dialogues.speaker: SHARON
dialogues.text: Hush. I want to hear this.  BROOKLYN NINE-NINE "The Bet" Shooting Draft 10/25/13 25.

dialogues.speaker: HOLT
dialogues.text: Boyle, let’s not-- Charles puts his hand over Holt’s mouth.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLES
dialogues.text: Hush. Truth time: (to Sharon) We love your husband. He’s a great cop. We will do anything to protect him. And you have incredibly attractive hands. Terry smiles, smug. Charles whips around to face him.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLES
dialogues.text: And you! What the hell are you doing, lying to your wife?! Unless you want to move into my ex-wife’s new boyfriend's basement with me, you have to man up. Don’t you ever keep anything from this beautiful woman again! (then to Sharon) Seriously, you are beautiful. And if he ever lies to you again, you can call me. Terry turns to Sharon.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: I’m sorry, honey. I just didn’t want to worry you.

dialogues.speaker: SHARON
dialogues.text: Hey. I’m always gonna worry about you. But if you say you’re ready, then get your ass back in the field. (off Terry's smile) But next time you keep something from me, I will leave you for this short earnest man and his ex-wife’s new boyfriend's apartment.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLES
dialogues.text: I know you’re kidding, but Hercules is actually a very good landlord. Sometimes when they go on nice vacations, I’m allowed to use the hot tub.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake looks out over the city, heroically. Then, a la Batm

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sleep well, Brooklyn, for tonight I am your guardian. *  BROOKLYN NINE-NINE "The Bet" Shooting Draft

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: (then) I don’t know how Batman does it. This is so scary. Jake jumps down.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: Hey, can you hand me the binoculars? They’re in my stakeout bag. She reaches into his bag.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Your stakeout bag is 98 percent nuts.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: Yeah, I get snacky. Nuts are great for you, they don’t have any fat.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Jake, that’s not true at all. That is waaaay off base. They eat nuts for a beat. Amy notices something.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: I think a pigeon just flew out of your car.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: Oh. Yeah, the windows don’t go up.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: I don’t know why I fought so hard to get that car -- it’s kind of a piece of crap. Honestly, why are you so into it?

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: You really want to know? It reminds me of my first time. Amy puts her hands over her ears.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Ewwww...

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: No, not that, my first arrest. Get your disgusting mind out of the gutter. (then) I was two days out of the academy. I’m super nervous. I see a guy run out of a bodega with a handful of cash. 10/25/13 26. 38  BROOKLYN NINE-NINE "The Bet" Shooting Draft 10/25/13 27. 38 39 40

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: I chase him, on foot, for 11 blocks before I catch up to him. I take him down and cuff him against the hood of a car. A green ‘68 Mustang. I look over... ‘for sale’ sign in the window. It was the best day of my life. So TI bought the car. (off her smile) And that’s when the debt began.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: “Crushing debt.” (off his smile) I remember my first arrest. I was seven. INT. AMY'S CHILDHOOD BEDROOM —- FLASHBACK - 1989 (FBD) YOUNG AMY has HER DOLL bust A TRANSFORMER.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG AMY
dialogues.text: There are two ways this can go down: the easy way or the hard way. The Transformer bolts. Her Doll shoots it in the back.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG AMY
dialogues.text: Oh yeah?! BAM! BAM! BAM! BAM!

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: The doll was in the right -- the robot was resisting arrest.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: That's what I said. And the judge, a stuffed owl, agreed. He was later disbarred for accepting bribes. I was a weird kid. Jake smiles.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: You know, I don’t think we’ve ever just sat down and had a real conversation. It’s kind of nice. Nut? Jake nods. She tosses one in his mouth. He catches it. tries to flip one in her mouth and fails miserably.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: Dude. Are you trying to catch it in your nose? 38 39

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She  BROOKLYN NINE-NINE "The Bet" Shooting Draft 10/25/13

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: I got it. I got it. Jake's phone RINGS and he checks it.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: It's Holt. Keep practicing. (answering phone) Peralta.

dialogues.speaker: HOLT
dialogues.text: Good news, I found someone from the night shift to relieve you on your stakeout. Jake checks his watch and thinks.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: +-.-I can still make it to Times Square... Jake looks back at Amy. She throws nuts in the air and catches them. She misses every one. A beat, then:

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: Eh, that’s okay, Captain. Don’t send the relief team. We’re already here, and I’m kind of curious to see what happens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake walks back to Amy.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: What did Holt want?

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: Just checking in. How you doing -- any better?

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Yup -- watch. She throws a BUNCH OF NUTS into the air and catches three

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: The key is volume.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: Awesome. Volume me! She throws a HANDFUL OF NUTS at his face.
BROOKLYN NINE-NINE "The Bet" Shooting Draft 10/25/13 29. 43 44

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake and Amy.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: Tell me the truth, if you’d won my car would you really have destroyed it?

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: No. I was gonna drive it...so I could learn stick. It would’ve been like... Amy mimes using a stick and makes grinding noises. Jake covers his ears and laughs, tortured.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Errreggggh. Clunk! Errrrrr. Clunk. Errrr. Oh no, I just scraped off the fender! Erreggh... A TRUCK pulls up on the street below. Jake puts his hand Amy’s arm, pointing.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: Look. There’s our guy. The truck backs up against a loading dock. TWO GUYS get o

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: What’s the play here?

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: Just follow my lead. Give me the ring. (then) Now give me some nuts. (intense) I’m snacky. She takes it off and hands it to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the guys unload boxes from the truck, Jake walks up, looking at a map program on his phone.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: You know what, honey, fine! I’11 ask the guy, will that make you happy?! He approaches one of the thugs.  44 BROOKLYN NINE-NINE "The Bet" Shooting Draft 10/25/13

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: Excuse me, sir --

dialogues.speaker: PERP
dialogues.text: We’re kinda busy here.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: My girlfriend thinks we're lost.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: No. I know we’re lost. I think he’s an idiot.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: Idiot?! You know why we’re out here in the middle of the night, Susan? Jake pulls out the ring. The SECOND GUY walks over, curio

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: I was going to propose to you at midnight on the Brooklyn Bridge, where we met.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Brooklyn Bridge?! We met on the Manhattan Bridge! You dumb moron!

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: You know what? This is over. Say goodbye to this ring and everything it stood for! Jake throws the ring.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Oh! You son of a bitch! The two men hurry over.

dialogues.speaker: PERP
dialogues.text: Hey! Stop yelling!

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: Don’t tell Susan what to-- Now! Amy and Jake pull out their guns and say:

dialogues.speaker: JAKE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Get down! NYPD! You’re under arrest! As they cuff the perps:

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: Nice work. 30.  BROOKLYN NINE-NINE "The Bet" Shooting Draft 10/25/13 31.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: You, too. Alright, let’s go.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: Uhhh, actually, I really need to find that ring -- it cost a fortune.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rosa is getting her coat. Charles enters.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLES
dialogues.text: Hey, I need to talk to you. Rosa looks around and realizes she’s trapped.

dialogues.speaker: ROSA
dialogues.text: Uh oh. It’s happening.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLES
dialogues.text: Remember when I took those bullets for you?

dialogues.speaker: ROSA
dialogues.text: Okay, let’s do this. You're sweet, but-- He takes a deep breath, then:

dialogues.speaker: CHARLES
dialogues.text: I didn't know it was you. When I jumped in front of the bullets, I didn’t know who I was protecting. I just saw a gun and an NYPD vest so I dove on instinct. Rosa is stunned.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLES
dialogues.text: You’ve been extra nice to me because you thought I risked my life for you, but I only did what every good cop would do. When you finally go out with me, and you will, it’ll be because I do things that only Charles Boyle would do. Charles turns on his heels and walks away, proud. Rosa is impressed. A beat later, he comes back.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLES
dialogues.text: Um, actually, I left my coat in -- it’s blue, calf-length. You know what? I don’t need it. He turns and walks away again, then returns.  BROOKLYN NINE-NINE "The Bet" Shooting Draft 10/25/13 32. 45 46 47

dialogues.speaker: CHARLES
dialogues.text: But it is really cold. It’s -- I see it -- can we just switch? They awkwardly switch places. INT. HOLT’S OFFICE — THE NEXT MORNING (D3) 46 Amy talks with Holt.

dialogues.speaker: HOLT
dialogues.text: Excellent job on the stakeout last night. I’m glad to see you two still work well together despite that ridiculous bet.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Thanks. Me too.

dialogues.speaker: HOLT
dialogues.text: And I appreciate you turning down the relief team. I’m not sure they would’ve been able to make that bust.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Yeah... right... relief team. Amy turns to exit and looks at Jake at his desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charles enters. Gina walks up to him.

dialogues.speaker: GINA
dialogues.text: Hey, Charles, what do you think about Scully's shirt?

dialogues.speaker: CHARLES
dialogues.text: I think it’s really elegant. REVEAL: Scully is wearing a purple, suede shirt.

dialogues.speaker: GINA
dialogues.text: He looks like an eggplant. (calling off) Captain Holt, Charles is back to normal, can I go home now?

dialogues.speaker: HOLT, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: No. It’s nine am. Gina walks away. Rosa passes.  BROOKLYN NINE-NINE "The Bet" Shooting Draft 10/25/13 33.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLES
dialogues.text: Hey Rosa, I got a new shipment of beans. They’re exquisite. Want a cup?

dialogues.speaker: ROSA
dialogues.text: Not even a little bit. Charles smiles. She smiles and exits. 48 INT. BULLPEN - JAKE'S DESK — CONTINUOUS (D3) 48 Amy walks up to Jake.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: So... sorry you lost so much money last night. Guess you can add it to your list of bad dates.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: Nah, it goes on the good date list. You know -- ‘cause we caught the bad guys.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: That's a very mature way to look at it.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: Well, I’m a very mature man. A DELIVERY GUY enters.

dialogues.speaker: DELIVERY GUY
dialogues.text: Package for Amy Santiago.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: That’s me...

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: Oh no! No, no, no, I forgot to cancel-- The Delivery Guy hits play on a BOOMBOX and strips for Am

dialogues.speaker: DELIVERY GUY
dialogues.text: Special Delivery from Jake Peralta...to say, “Thanks for last night.”

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: I’‘1l take this bullet for you, Amy! Jake jumps between Amy and the Stripper, who GRINDS on hi

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: Ew! I deserve a Medal of Valor for this!
